column2: ” Counseling Sessions|As Bucs All-Pro left tackle Tristan Wirfs eloquently said last week
column3: “I was going through some sh*t.” It’s been documented that Wirfs had a lot of anxiety when the Bucs asked him to move from right tackle to left tackle after the 2022 season. Wirfs has said he sought help from the team psychologist
column4: but he went deeper into what was happening during his sitdown with The Pivot podcast. “I’m harder on myself than anybody. So it’s like
column7: ‘I’m not going to be good enough.’ Like I remember having nightmares giving up sacks
column9: strip-sacks to end the game. There were nightmares where I couldn’t take a pass [protection] set. Just stupid stuff. And I’m like
column11: Wirfs said he was “freakin’ out” and dealing with stress tied to not being good enough and high expectations. He said his counseling was all about processes to “replace the negative thoughts with positive thoughts.” Interestingly
column12: Wirfs’ anxiety returned when it came time to extend his contract last summer. The deal was being worked early in training camp and Wirfs was sitting out practice — and again freaking out. Wirfs said he got professional help again. The same doctor
column14: explained to him that “nobody’s worth that much money
column15: ” referring to his pending new contract
column16: but that’s the market so he is worth it and must accept it. “Getting over that fear of not living up to that [contract]” is what Wirfs said he worked on
column17: and he still feels that pressure of high expectations today. Simply stated. Wirfs cares a lot. And it’s a beautiful thing. Joe can relate to debilitating Bucs nightmares. It’s known around here as The Lost Decade of Buccaneers football. May it rest in peace.|2025-02-17 17:38:00|303|16|3|Tristan Wirfs|Wirfs struggles with anxiety and high expectations|4|Mix of pessimistic and optimistic comments with some focusing on mental health and positivity.|"{""commenter0"": {""username"": ""Tbbucs3""

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/chauncey-golston-and-the-bucs/|Chauncey Golston And The Bucs|The Bucs need upgrades at edge rusher/outside linebacker. Joe assumes the team is aware of this. No more chatter about the legendary practice play of José Ramirez and Markees Watts. No more tales about how Joe Tryon-Shoyinka is a multi-talented chess piece but fans can’t see it. Joe wants fresh bodies
column2: including a beast of a proven edge rusher. But do the Bucs want to pay a huge price to get a proven beast? Doubtful. So Joe has been studying available edge rushers that might fit into the comfort zone of the Tampa Bay front office. Pending Cowboys free agent Chauncey Golston could be one of those guys. A late third-round pick by the Cowboys in 2021
column3: Golston played in college at Iowa with Tristan Wirfs and Anthony Nelson. Buccaneers general manager Jason Licht surely saw plenty of college film on Golston and has great intel on what kind of guy he is. Golston was a durable backup with the Cowboys until last season. Then DeMarcus Lawrence and Micah Parsons got hurt early and Golston made 13 starts and walked away with 5 1/2 sacks and an interception. His stock went up at the right time
column4: and he turned 26 years old this month. At 6-5
column6: Golston seems to fit the recent Bucs mold of preferring big dudes off the edge — guys that can mix it up well inside against the run. A Golston signing wouldn’t generate much applause from Bucs fans
column7: but it might be a kind of quiet upgrade the team is seeking.|2025-02-17 12:59:00|258|31|5|Chauncey Golston|Bucs seek edge rusher upgrade with potential Cowboys free agent.|6|Mixed opinions on potential edge rusher signings

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/draft-success/|Draft Success|A lot of fans grumble about Bucs coach Todd Bowles because they feel the Bucs should have won more than 10 games. They blame Bowles for holding the team back. Well
column2: if you figure the Bucs are a 12-win (or more?) team
column3: then Bucs AC/DC-loving general manager Jason Licht and his staff are getting the job done. The Bucs tied for third in the NFL with the highest percentage of first- and second-round draft picks starting for their teams during the 2024 season. The Eagles are the only 2024 division winner who had a higher percent of first- and second-round dpics in their starting lineup. The Bucs’ percentage of starters from their first- and second-round draft picks is 80 percent. The Eagles have 90. The Bears were highest at 91 percent. They’re a garbage team. So that’s not getting the job done. The slimy Saints are tied with the Bucs at 80 percent. The slimy Saints stink. Such a pity. So yeah
